717700f.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 100th Street
717700f.text:
Broadway, east side, Efrom 101st to 100th Streets. The fifteenstory Walter Ams Apartment Bcise occupies the centre.
About 1925.
JJohn Adams Davis.
Nc; I4S

717697f-b.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 100th Street (West)
717697f-b.text:
Broadway, at, adjoining and north of the N. W. corner of West 100th Street (left), as photographed to show the frame building directly at the corner. This bears No. 2641 Broadway and is a 3 story structure. These views are northwestward, two of which include an extensive perspective westward on the north side of 100th Street, continuing across West End Avenue
to Riverside Drive.
View 1: About 1932
J. Clarence Davies Collection
Museum of the City of N. Y.
Negative No. 339
Ne, W 1i2  View 2: November 7, 1937
P. L. Sperr
View 3: May 9, 1938
George D. Chinn
Neg. ir 1119

717698f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 100th Street (West)
717698f-a.text:
2648 Broadway, east side, between West 100th and 101st Street's, showing the frame residence of the Rev. J. Peters. This site was later improved with a 15 story apartment house. At the left is the 7
story Milford.
1901
H. N. Tiemann, photo
Gift of Urbrock Collection
Neg ~ 1i41

717696f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 100th Street
717696f-a.text:
House in the rear of 2628 Broadway, adjoining the S.E. corner
of 100th Street.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 323.

717699f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 100th Street
717699f-a.text:
The residence of the Rev. J. Peters, 2648 Broadway, east side, between 100th and 101st Streets. This frame house will be replaced by a 15-story apartment house. The seven-story Milford, however,
seen in the background, will still stand in 1936.
About 1902.
Brown Brothers.  ,
